net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.bundle

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.bundle.Buffer

  • public class Buffer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to store float data in order of index.
    Since:
    Feb 16, 2013 at 3:23:16 AM, v0.1
    Version:
    Feb 26, 2013 at 6:39:16 AM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(int size)
      Create a Buffer suitable for storing a specific amount of floats.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginEditing()
      Bind the Buffer and mapBuffer in order to edit the data within the Buffer.
      void bind()
      Bind the Buffer as the current Buffer to be used.
      void endEditing()
      Unbind the Buffer.
      float getData(int index)
      Get the float data at the specified index.
      int getId() 
      int getPosition()
      Get the current position of the Buffer.
      int getSize()
      Get the capacity of the Buffer.
      boolean isBound()
      Get whether or not the Bound is currently bound and ready to be used.
      void setData(int index, float data)
      Method used for setting the value at the specified index to the specified value of the float.
      void setData(int index, float[] data)
      Method used for setting the values at the specified index to the specified values of the floats in the data array.
      void setPosition(int position)
      Set the place in which the Buffer will next insert data into.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Create a String representing all of the float data in the Buffer.

        Create a Buffer suitable for storing a specific amount of floats.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the capacity of the Buffer. The max amount of data that can be stored in this Buffer.
        Returns:
        The capacity of the Buffer. The max amount of data that can be stored in this Buffer.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Get the current position of the Buffer. This is the index that you will next insert values into.
        Returns:
        The current position of the Buffer. This is the index that you will next insert values into.

      • beginEditing

        public void beginEditing()
        Bind the Buffer and mapBuffer in order to edit the data within the Buffer.

      • endEditing

        public void endEditing()
        Unbind the Buffer. No longer able to edit after this call.
